notesStmt.note: A large portion is missing at the beginning and at the end. Several folios are missing within the manuscript. Considerable amount od folios are imperfectly preserved, especially damaged are folios 66, 88, 93, 11-115, 121-122, 134.
On the margin of folios 55r, 145r are expository notes which partly agree with Rashi.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Parts of the Hagiographa, provided with vowel-points and accents, with partial Arabic and Aramaic translation.

collation.p:
Originally 28 quires of 10 leaves each, signed with Hebrew letters on the first and last pages, and marked with catchwords on the last page.
Currently most quires are incomplete.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script, punctuated and accentuated, of 14th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Hagiographa with Arab. Vers. & Targum. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2377.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 23 July 1881 (folio [226v]).
